p: Methods: The study was based on a prospective cohort of critically ill patients in whom Renal Angina Index score was completed with a 72Â hour follow up of serum creatinine levels, water balance and urinary output, establishing after patients that develop AKI. Afterwards a relationship was established between Renal Angina Index score and its predictive capacity of developing AKI, determining sensibility, specificity, positive predictive value and negative predictive value for the score.
